intro: Cyclopogon antioquiensis, commonly known as the Antioquian cyclopogon, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of Colombia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family, and is characterized by its unique floral structure. The plant produces striking, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color, with intricate patterns on the petals. It thrives in high-altitude cloud forests, where it relies on specific microclimatic conditions for survival. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered an endangered species.
